intro: Dombeya mananarensis, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, forested areas and is known for its ornamental value. Dombeya mananarensis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
